intro: Danais nigra, commonly known as the black danais, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
